subject: Politics
title: The French Revolution
description: A fast breakdown of The French Revolution for builders.

hook.text: France's revolution promised liberty, equality, fraternity. It delivered the guillotine, terror, and then Napoleon.

buildup.text: By 1789, France was bankrupt. Nobles paid no taxes. The poor starved while the court feasted at Versailles.

discovery.text: The storming of the Bastille on July 14 symbolized the overthrow of tyranny. It became France's national day.

twist.text: The revolution devoured its own. Robespierre led the Terror, executing thousands â€” then was executed himself.

climax.text: Napoleon seized power from the revolutionary chaos. Liberty gave way to empire within a decade.

punchline.text: France's revolution changed the world. But it didn't deliver what it promised.

quiz.question: What happened to Robespierre, leader of the Reign of Terror?
options: He was executed by the same revolutionary process he led
